verses.name: Philemon 1:1
verses.text: Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothy our brother, unto Philemon our dearly beloved, and fellowlabourer,

verses.name: Philemon 1:2
verses.text: And to our beloved Apphia, and Archippus our fellowsoldier, and to the church in thy house:

verses.name: Philemon 1:3
verses.text: Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Philemon 1:4
verses.text: I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,

verses.name: Philemon 1:5
verses.text: Hearing of thy love and faith, which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all saints;

verses.name: Philemon 1:6
verses.text: That the communication of thy faith may become effectual by the acknowledging of every good thing which is in you in Christ Jesus.

verses.name: Philemon 1:7
verses.text: For we have great joy and consolation in thy love, because the bowels of the saints are refreshed by thee, brother.

verses.name: Philemon 1:8
verses.text: Wherefore, though I might be much bold in Christ to enjoin thee that which is convenient,

verses.name: Philemon 1:9
verses.text: Yet for love’s sake I rather beseech thee, being such an one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Philemon 1:10
verses.text: I beseech thee for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten in my bonds:

verses.name: Philemon 1:11
verses.text: Which in time past was to thee unprofitable, but now profitable to thee and to me:

verses.name: Philemon 1:12
verses.text: Whom I have sent again: thou therefore receive him, that is, mine own bowels:

verses.name: Philemon 1:13
verses.text: Whom I would have retained with me, that in thy stead he might have ministered unto me in the bonds of the gospel:

verses.name: Philemon 1:14
verses.text: But without thy mind would I do nothing; that thy benefit should not be as it were of necessity, but willingly.

verses.name: Philemon 1:15
verses.text: For perhaps he therefore departed for a season, that thou shouldest receive him for ever;

verses.name: Philemon 1:16
verses.text: Not now as a servant, but above a servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much more unto thee, both in the flesh, and in the Lord?

verses.name: Philemon 1:17
verses.text: If thou count me therefore a partner, receive him as myself.

verses.name: Philemon 1:18
verses.text: If he hath wronged thee, or oweth thee ought, put that on mine account;

verses.name: Philemon 1:19
verses.text: I Paul have written it with mine own hand, I will repay it: albeit I do not say to thee how thou owest unto me even thine own self besides.

verses.name: Philemon 1:20
verses.text: Yea, brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my bowels in the Lord.

verses.name: Philemon 1:21
verses.text: Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote unto thee, knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.

verses.name: Philemon 1:22
verses.text: But withal prepare me also a lodging: for I trust that through your prayers I shall be given unto you.

verses.name: Philemon 1:23
verses.text: There salute thee Epaphras, my fellowprisoner in Christ Jesus;

verses.name: Philemon 1:24
verses.text: Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lucas, my fellowlabourers.

verses.name: Philemon 1:25
verses.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.  Written from Rome to Philemon, by Onesimus a servant.
